The 'Indian Ocean' is the third largest of the world's oceanic divisions,
covering approximately 20% of the water on the Earth's surface. It is bounded by Asiaâincluding India, after which the ocean

As one component of the World Ocean, the Indian Ocean is delineated from the
Atlantic Ocean by the 20Â° east meridian running south from Cape Agulhas, and
from the Pacific Ocean by the meridian of 146Â°55'
east. [http://www.iho.shom.fr/publicat/free/files/S23_1953.pdf Limits of
Oceans and Seas]. International Hydrographic Organization Special Publication
No. 23, 1953. The northernmost extent of the Indian Ocean is approximately
30Â° north in the Persian Gulf. The ocean is nearly km (mi) wide at the southern
tips of Africa and Australia, and its area is kmÂ²
(miÂ²), [http://www.enchantedlearning.com/subjects/ocean/ Earth's Oceans].
EnchantedLearning.com. Retrieved on 2013-07-16. including the Red Sea and
the Persian Gulf.

The ocean's volume is estimated to be kmÂ³ (miÂ³). Small islands dot the continental rims. Island
nations within the ocean are Madagascar (the world's fourth largest island),
Comoros, Seychelles, Maldives, Mauritius, and Sri Lanka. The archipelago of
Indonesia borders the ocean on the east.
